articles.description: Medical costs of German COVID-19 patients who have left hospitals are on average 50% higher than before they were admitted, data from a major insurer showed, a sign that even those who have recovered struggle to regain full health.
articles.content:
By Reuters Staff

articles.author: The Seattle Times
articles.title: Flu vs. coronavirus: New study shows hospital deaths for COVID-19 twice the rate of influenza patients - OregonLive
articles.description: The study is believed to be the first in the United States to directly compare clinical features, laboratory results and health outcomes between COVID-19 patients and flu patients.
articles.content:
SEATTLE COVID-19 patients had an in-hospital death rate two times higher than that of influenza patients, according to a new study.

articles.title: Four mild symptoms of COVID to spot - they could be the first sign you're falling ill - Express
articles.description: COVID-19 symptoms have been shown to manifest themselves in different ways. While a high temperature, new, continuous cough and a loss or change to sense of smell or taste are recognised as the main symptoms, other signs have also been identified.
